result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michelle Anne Springston was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1800.00 inclusive of all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: with 111 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Ignition Interlock on all vehicles she owns for 3 years.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  
Provide a DNA sample.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Anne Springston

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc

Certification of PLEA & SENTENCING transcript commencing 08/17/2015 received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION. mt

Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in custody.  Patrick Anderson  Deputy court clerk:  vk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  As to Count 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and elements received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Count 2:  Dismissed as a matter of law.  Count 3:  Pursuant to negotiations and on motion of the State Court dismissed the count.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  39 MONTHS with 111 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 15 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.
Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and is ELIGIBLE for the WI Substance Abuse program.  
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court orders the following:
Drivers License suspension for 3 years.
Ignition Interlock on all vehicles she owns for 3 years
Provide a DNA sample

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Fine in the amount of $1800.00 inclusive of all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 

All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges  be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of her right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letter from defendant received and filed.
Court ordered $1,000 cash bail with all conditions of bail previously set.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Michelle Anne Springston not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail review.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS defense motion for bail reduction.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19 for plea and sentencing on 08/17/2015.
At the request of the defense attorney, case set for bail review 06/09/2015 at 8:30am in Branch 22.

Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in custody.  Ronald Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.  ALSO SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in court with attorney Paul J. Manley.  Defendant Michelle Anne Springston in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
